docs.text: AWS Guide This documentation serves as a collection of AWS guides for my own consumption. Hope it can help you in the journey to master how to use services in this dominant cloud provider.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: This documentation serves as a collection of AWS guides for my own consumption. Hope it can help you in the journey to master how to use services in this dominant cloud provider.
docs.title: AWS Guide

docs.text: AWS CLI The AWS Command Line Interface , aws cli for short, allows us to easily access AWS services in the terminal. Command Syntax # command syntax aws --<optional-command> <main-command> <subcommand> <parameters> # e.g. aws s3 mb s3://bucketname We can find more info in the online CLI help docs, or just type aws s3 mb help if needed. Configure To make it easier to send commands without the need to enter the secrets and passwords, we can set a default profile or a specific profile name with those variables. Cmd Desc aws configure enter access, secret & region names, for default profile aws configure --profile <name> enter access, secret & region names, based on a specific name nano ~/.aws/credentials run containers aws s3 ls --profile <name> enter commands based on profile
docs.title: AWS CLI
